{"step_by_step_thinking": "The MB2 canal is the second mesiobuccal canal in the maxillary first molar. According to Document [0], the distance from MB1 to MB2 was 2.06 ± 0.52 mm. Document [1] states that in 65 molars, the MB2 canal orifices was located 0.87 mm distally and 1.73 mm palatally to the main mesiobuccal canal. Document [3] also mentions that the average interorifice distance was found to be 1.91 ± 0.59 mm for MB1-MB2. Document [14] states that the MB2 canal was found in a high percentage of the sample and was located 2.68 ± 0.49 mm palatally and 1.25 ± 0.34 mm mesially to the MB1 canal. All these documents suggest that the MB2 canal is located mesiopalatally to the MB1 canal.", "answer_choice": "D. Mesiopalatal to MB1"}
